definition: to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin
to sell/to make or carry out (a plan or intrigue etc)
forehead/horizontal tablet or inscribed board/specified number or amount

sentences.english: The specific methods for calculating net selling amount and Royalty are detailed in Appendix3 to the Contract.
sentences.chinese: 淨銷售額和提成費的具體計算方法詳見本合同附件三。

sentences.english: How much sales has music handsets brought for Nokia in 2006?
sentences.chinese: 2006年諾基亞音樂手機帶來的銷售額有多大？

sentences.english: TV manufacturers have enjoyed a ten-percent rise in sales over the past year.
sentences.chinese: 去年電視製造商們已經把電視銷售額提高了10%。

sentences.english: The overall sales of the wholesalers increased by 10%.
sentences.chinese: 批發商的總銷售額增加了百分之十。

sentences.english: Women’s weekly magazines tend to rely utterly on news-stand sales.
sentences.chinese: 婦女週刊趨向於全部依靠報攤的銷售額。

sentences.english: It does not matter whether he fails an exam or miss a sale.
sentences.chinese: 一次考試的失敗或是丟掉了一點銷售額都沒有關係。

sentences.english: The competitive sales of each corporation are less than 4 per centum of that corporations total sales.
sentences.chinese: 每個公司的競爭規模少於該公司的總銷售額4%。

sentences.english: A powerful launching campaign resulted in the large sales of the new type of air-conditioner.
sentences.chinese: 強有力投放市場活動使該款新空調的銷售額大增。

sentences.english: Sales in our company have increased up to four-fold in the last five years.
sentences.chinese: 過去五年中，我公司的銷售額已增長至四倍。

sentences.english: While Dell sales went up, the Dell brand went down.
sentences.chinese: 在戴爾銷售額上升的同時，品牌卻落後了。

sentences.english: The peak & valley of Chinese real estate industry development should be appraised by the growth rate of sales volume.
sentences.chinese: 中國房地產業發展的峯谷應以銷售額增長率來評價。

sentences.english: Sales of the Aerospace Division are both commercial and defense-related.
sentences.chinese: 航空部門的銷售額包括軍用和商用兩個方面。

sentences.english: Snus sales and volumes grew in all Scandinavian markets.
sentences.chinese: 在所有的北歐市場中，鼻菸銷售額和銷量都增長。

sentences.english: Total sales were down 27% to just under €9.3bn.
sentences.chinese: 總銷售額下降了27%，略低於93億歐元。

sentences.english: The resulting balance of -15% marked the third month in a row of declining sales.
sentences.chinese: 調查結果15%的差額標誌着銷售額連續三個月下降。

sentences.english: His sales of one-euro items have risen about 20% in the last couple of years.
sentences.chinese: 過去幾年裏，他的一歐元商品銷售額增加了約20%。

definition: financial year/fiscal year (e.g. from April to March, for tax purposes)
achievement/accomplishment/(in more recent usage) performance (of a business, employee etc)/results
sum or volume of business transactions/turnover
to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
